section.section: The Prince George's Authority consists of seven Commissioners nominated by the County Executive and confirmed by the County Council.
The County Council shall hold a public hearing before voting whether to confirm each nominee.
The term of a Prince George's Authority Commissioner is 5 years.
The terms of Commissioners are staggered as required by the terms of the members serving on October 1, 2006.
At the end of a term, a Commissioner continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A Commissioner who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of that term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The County Executive may remove a Commissioner with the approval of the County Council of Prince George's County.
